abstract.shortdesc: Prerequisites list what users must have/do before they can perform a task.
abstract.p: Prerequisites may be, but are not limited to:

ul.li: Documentation/justifications that readers need to provide

rule.rule-statement: If there are multiple prerequisites, list them as unordered nouns or expressions.

ul.li: Transformations include an automated title that reads Prerequisite(s) and that makes the purpose of the items obvious to users.
One bullet equals one requirement. It's not necessarily true with paragraphs.

examplefig.codeblock:
• One accepted primary id
  • One accepted secondary id
  • Proof of citizenship: birth certificate, non-expired passport, citizen card

Working knowledge of:

  • HTTP requests
  • Array/JSON manipulation
  • IF and WHILE statements
 ...

examplefig.desc: In the context of a course that delivers a certification, when students absolutely require the previous level, state it.

rule.rule-statement: Include prerequisites when people need to gather documentation or any type of information, such as account or credit card numbers.
